intro:
There's a number of blog posts I've _thought_ about writing, but haven't gotten around to yet ---
things like:
* Projects I'd like to start
* Ideas for features in various environments (programs, languages, etc.)
* Discussions of some of my experiences (more

So I've put them here for now -- so if you're reading this and there's something that particularly
speaks to you, feel free to let me know! You can email me at `<firstname><lastname>@gmail.com`.

posts.title: Why can't we have nice things?
posts.description:
A mini-series about certain types of software with problems that people tend to accept as a fact of
life -- editors, programming languages, typesetting systems, and more.

This naturally leads into a few other posts that I've thought about writing.

posts.title: On making an editor
posts.description: Laying out some of the problems I see with existing code editors, and why I have the gall to think I can do better

posts.title: Put your ideas out there!
posts.description:
I've had a number of ideas for improving existing systems that I never really talked about; other
people wrote about them first, with widespread support in their respective communities.

The world can benefit from new ideas.

posts.title: Ideas for a new kind of Regex engine
posts.description:
One of the perks of writing an editor designed to support the extremes is that _nearly every_
existing system will eventually fail before you want it to. Regex engines are no exception.

This would be an outline of some of the ways that the interface to such a Regex engine must be
different -- and how some of the performance penalty can be recovered.

This Regex engine *will* eventually exist, it's just going to take a while.
